TextJPN: 電話が突然鳴った。
TextENG: The phone suddenly rang.

TextJPN: 慌ててがばっと起きる。
TextENG: I woke up in a hurry.

TextJPN: …時計は夜の９時。
TextENG: ...The clock read 9 p.m..

TextJPN: 「…しまった…！！@k@vS05/13/101300251.　定時連絡の時間を…寝過ごした…」
TextENG: ``...Dammit...!!@k@vS05/13/101300251. I slept past the time I was supposed to report in...``

TextJPN: 受話器を取る。
TextENG: I picked up the receiver.

TextJPN: 「赤坂さま。@k@vS05/00/front00002.外線からお電話が入っておりますが、お繋ぎしてもよろしいでしょうか？@k@vS05/00/front00003.　ご同僚の嘉納さまと申されております」
TextENG: ``Akasaka-sama.@k@vS05/00/front00002. You have a call from an outside line, shall I connect you?@k@vS05/00/front00003. It's from a coworker named Kanou-sama.``

TextJPN: …やはり。@k…定時連絡の電話がないので、かけてきたのだ。
TextENG: ...I knew it.@k ...I didn't call in, so they had phoned me.

TextJPN: 「…すみません、繋いで下さい」
TextENG: ``...Sorry, please put them through.``

TextJPN: 「かしこまりました。@k@vS05/00/front00005.お繋ぎしますので、一度受話器を置いてお待ち下さい」
TextENG: ``Understood.@k@vS05/00/front00005. I'll connect you, so please hang up the receiver for the time being.``

TextJPN: 受話器を置き、数秒すると、すぐに再びコール音が鳴った。
TextENG: After I had put down the receiver for a few seconds, the phone began to ring again.
``Yes, hello?@k@vS05/13/101300254. This is Akasaka...!``

TextJPN: 「赤坂くん？@k@vS05/00/VV_kano_10015.　嘉納です。@k@vS05/00/VV_kano_10016.お疲れさま。@k@vS05/00/VV_kano_10017.定時連絡がなかったので、こちらから掛けました。@k@vS05/00/VV_kano_10018.そちらの状況はどう？」
TextENG: ``Akasaka-kun?@k@vS05/00/VV_kano_10015. This is Kanou.@k@vS05/00/VV_kano_10016. Good work out there.@k@vS05/00/VV_kano_10017. You didn't call in for your regular report, so we called instead.@k@vS05/00/VV_kano_10018. What's your situation?``

TextJPN: …定時連絡に遅れたことへのお説教は、とりあえず後回しにして、先輩は本題に入ってくれた。
TextENG: ...Leaving the lecture for later, my senior coworker got straight to the point.

TextJPN: 「今日は雛見沢村へ実踏に行きました。@k@vS05/13/101300256.観光客を装うことで、村長以下の何人かの死守同盟の要人との接触に成功。@k@vS05/13/101300257.何も聞き出すには至りませんでしたが、好印象を得て、明日以降への繋ぎを作ることができました」
TextENG: ``Today I went to the village proper.@k@vS05/13/101300256. Under the guise of a tourist, I managed to establish contact with the mayor and several other core members of the Guardians.@k@vS05/13/101300257. I wasn't able to ask them anything, but I left a good impression and was able to make a bridge for my investigation from tomorrow onwards.``

TextJPN: 「そう。@k@vS05/00/VV_kano_10020.なかなか手際がいいね。@k@vS05/00/VV_kano_10021.赤坂くんのどこか初々しい感じが、むしろ武器になったかもしれないね。@k@vS05/00/VV_kano_10022.まずは上首尾ってところかな？」
TextENG: ``I see.@k@vS05/00/VV_kano_10020. It looks like things are going smoothly.@k@vS05/00/VV_kano_10021. Akasaka-kun, you seem rather naive sometimes, but that might have worked in your favor.@k@vS05/00/VV_kano_10022. I guess you made some good progress for now?``

TextJPN: 「…比較するほど経験がないので、上首尾かはわかりませんが、@k@vS05/13/101300259.…とりあえず今日のところは順調だと思います」
TextENG: ``...I don't have the experience to make a comparison, so I don't know if it's that good or not.@k@vS05/13/101300259. ...I think things went well for today, though.``

TextJPN: 「県警での情報や、地元警察の公安での情報と照らしてどう？@k@vS05/00/VV_kano_10024.　鬼ヶ淵死守同盟はシロっぽい？」
TextENG: ``Did you find out anything from the prefectural or local offices?@k@vS05/00/VV_kano_10024. Does it look as though the Onigafuchi Guardians is unrelated to this incident?``

TextJPN: それに対して、私は…。
TextENG: I, um...

TextJPN: まだわかりません。
TextENG: I still didn't know.

TextJPN: …そう即答できるはずなのに、……それを告げるだけなのに、なぜか、…@bためら.@<躊躇@>われた。
TextENG: ...I should have been able to say that immediately. ...I only had to say that, but for some reason... I hesitated.

TextJPN: 「……まだ、調査中ですので、何とも」
TextENG: ``...I'm still investigating, so I don't know what to say yet.``

TextJPN: 私は率直な感想を、先輩に伝えた。
TextENG: I gave my senior my honest impressions.

TextJPN: 「いえ、まだわかりません。@k@vS05/13/VX_akasaka_0012.もう少し時間をかけてみますが、正直見込みはどうだか…」
TextENG: ``No, I don't know yet.@k@vS05/13/VX_akasaka_0012. I'll give it some more time, but I'm honestly not very optimistic...``

TextJPN: 「そう。@k@vS05/00/VV_kano_10026.なるべく早めにね。@k@vS05/00/VV_kano_10027.わかってると思うけど、今夜が終われば、誘拐から丸４日が経過する」
TextENG: ``I see.@k@vS05/00/VV_kano_10026. Could you let us know as soon as possible?@k@vS05/00/VV_kano_10027. I think you understand, but after tonight, it'll have been a full four days since the kidnapping happened.``

TextJPN: 「…いつが時間切れという明白な区切りはないけど、時間の経過は確実に我々の状況を不利にしていく。@k@vS05/00/VV_kano_10029.…それはわかってるよね」
TextENG: ``...They didn't set a time limit, but it's obvious that time is not on our side.@k@vS05/00/VV_kano_10029. ...I think you know that.``

TextJPN: 「えぇ。@k@vS05/13/101300262.わかっています。@k@vS05/13/101300263.迅速に、だけれど細心の注意で調査を続けます」
TextENG: ``Yeah.@k@vS05/13/101300262. I know.@k@vS05/13/101300263. I'll investigate a little quicker, while still being careful about it.``

TextJPN: 「うん。@k@vS05/00/VV_kano_10031.くれぐれも気をつけてね。@k@vS05/00/VV_kano_10032.相手は暴力主義団体なんだから。@k@vS05/00/VV_kano_10033.…油断すれば危険もありえるからね。@k@vS05/00/VV_kano_10034.危険が迫ったらすぐに連絡を。@k@vS05/00/VV_kano_10035.その場合は地元公安に応援体制を入れられるようにするからね」
TextENG: ``Okay.@k@vS05/00/VV_kano_10031. Be sure to look after yourself.@k@vS05/00/VV_kano_10032. You're dealing with a violent organization here.@k@vS05/00/VV_kano_10033. ...It might be dangerous to let your guard down.@k@vS05/00/VV_kano_10034. If you feel that you're in any danger, contact me immediately.@k@vS05/00/VV_kano_10035. In that case, I can get the local Public Safety Office prepared to help you.``

TextJPN: 「ありがとうございます。@k@vS05/13/101300265.頑張ります」
TextENG: ``Thank you.@k@vS05/13/101300265. I'll do my best.``

TextJPN: 「…他に赤坂くんの方から連絡はある？」
TextENG: ``...Anything else to report?``

TextJPN: いくつかの補足と、事務上の連絡を加え、…最後の最後で聞いてみた。
TextENG: I reported several bits of supplementary information... and at the very end, I decided to ask.

TextJPN: 「…そちらの調査の進展はどうですか？」
TextENG: ``...How's the investigation going on your end?``

TextJPN: 「うん。@k@vS05/00/VV_kano_10049.こっちもみんな頑張ってるけど、なかなかはかどらないよ。@k@vS05/00/VV_kano_10050.何しろ、調べる団体が星の数だからね」
TextENG: ``Hm.@k@vS05/00/VV_kano_10049. Everybody's doing their best here, but we're not making much progress.@k@vS05/00/VV_kano_10050. After all, the number of organizations we're investigating is vast.

TextJPN: 「だから君の方の団体も、シロだとわかったらすぐに帰京して他の職員の応援に入ってもらいたいんだよ」
TextENG: So, if you find out the one you're investigating is in the clear, we'll have you return to Tokyo to assist some of the other officers.

TextJPN: 「…室長は鬼ヶ淵も洗っとけって言ってるけど、俺は鬼ヶ淵なんかの反ダム住民団体なんかは、今回の件、まったく無縁だと思ってるからね」
TextENG: ...The Chief is saying to dig up what you can on Onigafuchi, but I don't think a residential anti-dam protest group has any relation to the incident at hand.

TextJPN: 「…職員ひとりを、一団体調べさせるためだけに出張させるのは、すごく痛いよホント」
TextENG: Sending somebody out just to investigate a single group makes me cringe, really.``

TextJPN: これはもうグチだ。
TextENG: At this point he was just complaining.

TextJPN: …のんびり出張を楽しんでないで、さっさと切り上げて帰って来いと言ってるようなものだ。
TextENG: ...He was telling me to stop taking time enjoying my trip. To finish up and get back quick.

TextJPN: 「なるべく早めにケリを付けるようにします」
TextENG: ``I'll try and resolve this as soon as I can.``

TextJPN: 「うん。よろしくね！@k@vS05/00/VV_kano_10055.　じゃ、他に何もなければ切るよ？」
TextENG: ``Thanks. I'm counting on you!@k@vS05/00/VV_kano_10055. Well then, if there's nothing else, I'm hanging up.``
``Okay.@k@vS05/13/101300269. That's all I have.``

TextJPN: 別れ際に、定時連絡に遅れたことへの小言をしっかり言われる。
TextENG: As we were ending our call, he scolded me thoroughly for being late with my regular report.

TextJPN: それから受話器を置き、…ベッドに大の字になって横たわった。
TextENG: After that, I hung up the phone and sprawled out on the bed.

TextJPN: …そう言えば、大石氏からの連絡がないな。
TextENG: ...Come to think of it, I hadn't heard anything from Ooishi.

TextJPN: 情報屋と落ち合う時間、場所を今夜、連絡してくれることになっているのだが。
TextENG: He was supposed to contact me about a time and place to meet with the informant tonight.

TextJPN: …定時連絡を忘れたことを怒られた腹いせに、大石氏に怒ろうかとも思ったが…。
TextENG: ...I thought about getting angry with Ooishi in retaliation for being scolded for forgetting my daily report...

TextJPN: 考えてみたら、大石氏は今夜中に電話するとしか言ってない。
TextENG: Come to think of it, though, Ooishi didn't really say anything other than that he was going to call tonight.

TextJPN: ……いつあるのかもわからない電話を待つというのは、それはそれで辛かった。
TextENG: ...Waiting for a phone call when you didn't know what time it was going to come was in itself rather difficult.

TextJPN: そう思った時、電話が鳴った。慌てて受話器を取る。
TextENG: Just when I thought that, the phone rang. I picked up the receiver in a hurry.

TextJPN: 「も、もしもし！」
TextENG: ``H-Hello?``

TextJPN: 「これはびっくりしました。@k@vS05/11/100700214.…赤坂さん、あなた受話器取るの早いですねぇ。@k@vS05/11/100700215.警官辞めても、大企業の営業で十分飯が食えますよ」
TextENG: ``Well, this is a surprise.@k@vS05/11/100700214. ...Akasaka-san, you're pretty quick to answer the phone.@k@vS05/11/100700215. You could quit the force and easily make a living in sales for some large corporation.``

TextJPN: 「まだ警官辞めた後のことなんか、考えたこともありません…！」
TextENG: ``I've never so much as considered quitting the force...!``

TextJPN: 「そこまで過剰に反応されると、…面白いなぁ。@k@vS05/11/100700217.なっはっはっは！@k@vS05/11/100700218.　しかし、いけないなぁ。因果な商売ですし今から考えても遅くないですよ。@k@vS05/11/100700219.んっふっふっふ！」
TextENG: ``The way you overreact is rather... interesting.@k@vS05/11/100700217. Na ha ha ha!@k@vS05/11/100700218. That's no good, it doesn't pay to be a cop and it's not too late to reconsider.@k@vS05/11/100700219. Nfu fu fu!``

TextJPN: 「…遠慮いたしますので、本題に入って下さい、大石さん」
TextENG: ``...I'll pass, so could you please get to the point, Ooishi-san?``

TextJPN: 「そうですか？@k@vS05/11/100700221.　それは残念です、じゃ老後の話は次の機会にでも。@k@vS05/11/100700222.…では本題に」
TextENG: ``Really?@k@vS05/11/100700221. Too bad, we'll leave the retirement conversation for next time, then.@k@vS05/11/100700222. ...Well, I'll get to the point.``

TextJPN: 鬼ヶ淵死守同盟の幹部には、周辺の地域に強い影響力を持つ人間が多い。
TextENG: Many of the executives in the Onigafuchi Guardians had a lot of sway in the neighboring regions.

TextJPN: 興宮の町にも、村の関係者がたくさんいる。
TextENG: Even in Okinomiya, there were a lot of people with relations in the village.

TextJPN: …だから、興宮の町から遠く離れたこの鹿骨繁華街で落ち合うのは、当然のことだった。
TextENG: ...That's why meeting in the Shishibone Market District, far from Okinomiya, was a matter of course.

TextJPN: 「赤坂さん、こっちこっち！@k@vS05/11/100700224.　ちょっと迷いましたか？@k@vS05/11/100700225.　北口からの方が、遠回りだけど道は分かりやすかったかもしれませんね」
TextENG: ``Akasaka-san, over here!@k@vS05/11/100700224. Did you get a little lost?@k@vS05/11/100700225. Coming from the north entrance might have been a bit of a detour, but it was easier to give directions from there.``

TextJPN: 「いえ、遅れて申し訳ありませんでした」
TextENG: ``No, I'm sorry for being late.``

TextJPN: 「夕飯はもう食べちゃいました？」
TextENG: ``Did you eat dinner already?``
``Yeah.@k@vS05/13/101300275. I already did.``

TextJPN: 「んじゃあ、お酒の飲めるお店に行きましょうか。@k@vS05/11/100700228.洋酒派？@k@vS05/11/100700229.　日本酒派？@k@vS05/11/100700230.　女の子のいる店といない店はどっちがいいですかね？@k@vS05/11/100700231.　むっふっふっふ！」
TextENG: ``Well then, shall we go to a place where we can get a drink?@k@vS05/11/100700228. Do you prefer western alcohol?@k@vS05/11/100700229. Or maybe sake?@k@vS05/11/100700230. Would you prefer a place with or without women?@k@vS05/11/100700231. Mfu fu fu fu!``

TextJPN: 「お構いなく。@k@vS05/13/101300277.勤務中は飲みませんので」
TextENG: ``Don't worry about it.@k@vS05/13/101300277. I don't drink while I'm on the job.``

TextJPN: それを聞き、大石氏の連れの男が仰け反りながら大笑いして、大石氏の肩をバンバン叩く。
TextENG: Hearing that, the man that Ooishi had brought along bent backwards as he guffawed, clapping Ooishi on the shoulder.

TextJPN: 「ねぇ？@k@vS05/11/100700233.　初々しい人でしょう？@k@vS05/11/100700234.　その分、ちょっぴりサービスしてあげて下さいよ。@k@vS05/11/100700235.あのお金は全部、彼のお財布から出てるんですからね」
TextENG: ``See?@k@vS05/11/100700233. Isn't he just adorable?@k@vS05/11/100700234. In exchange, can you give him a bit extra?@k@vS05/11/100700235. That money all came from this guy's wallet, you know.``

TextJPN: 大石氏が連れてきた男は、まるでダフ屋か馬の予想屋のような風貌の、見るからに怪しい男だった。
TextENG: The man that Ooishi had brought seemed almost like a ticket scalper or a bookie. Even his appearance was dubious.

TextJPN: 情報屋がいたずらっぽく、にやぁと笑い出す。
TextENG: The informant grinned deviously.

TextJPN: 「おい坊主。@k@vS05/00/104400002.お前、旦那にいくら渡した？@k@vS05/00/104400003.　だいぶ途中でつまみ食いされてんぞぉ？」
TextENG: ``Hey boy.@k@vS05/00/104400002. How much did you give this guy?@k@vS05/00/104400003. It looks like there was quite a bit skimmed off the top, you know.``

TextJPN: 「大石氏への仲介手数料も含めていますから、それも含んだ上です」
TextENG: ``Ooishi's handling fee was included, so I took that into account.``

TextJPN: 情報屋は私に、もっと喜怒哀楽の大きい反応を期待していたらしい。
TextENG: It seemed that the informant had expected a more extravagant reaction on my part.

TextJPN: …私が至って平然と答えると、自分とはまったくタイプの違う人間なんだと認識したようだった。
TextENG: ...When I responded matter-of-factly, he realized that I was an entirely different type of person than he was.

TextJPN: だがそれは、反りが合わないと敬遠されるというよりは、珍しいものに興味をそそられているようにも見える…。
TextENG: But rather than putting a distance between us, it seemed that I had piqued his interest...

TextJPN: 「だから言ったでしょ。@k@vS05/11/100700237.真面目な人なんです。@k@vS05/11/100700238.でもねぇ赤坂さん？@k@vS05/11/100700239.　私たちのような職種の人間は、豊富な社会経験がとても武器になるんですよ？」
TextENG: ``I said it, didn't I?@k@vS05/11/100700237. He's the serious type.@k@vS05/11/100700238. But do you see, Akasaka-san?@k@vS05/11/100700239. People in a line of work like ours can really use their wealth of experience to their advantage.``

TextJPN: 「女の子がいてお酒が飲めるお店での経験が、どう武器になるか疑問です…」
TextENG: ``I'm wondering exactly how the experience of drinking in a bar with women would work to my advantage...``

TextJPN: 「わっはははっはっはっは！！」
TextENG: ``Waa hahaha haaa ha ha!!``

TextJPN: 情報屋はこらえきれなくなり、人目もはばからず、腹を抱えて大笑いした。
TextENG: The informant, unable to contain himself, clutched at his stomach as he guffawed, heedless of the people watching.

TextJPN: 「いやぁ…もう！@k@vS05/11/100700241.　赤坂さんはいちいち察しがいいなぁ！@k@vS05/11/100700242.　いよッ、さすが高学歴！」
TextENG: ``Oh lawdie!@k@vS05/11/100700241. Akasaka-san, you really can judge people!@k@vS05/11/100700242. That's what an education does for you!``

TextJPN: 「…大石さん？@k@vS05/13/101300281.　あなた、どこかで飲んできましたね！@k@vS05/13/101300282.　酔っぱらってます？！」
TextENG: ``...Ooishi-san?@k@vS05/13/101300281. You've been drinking somewhere, haven't you!@k@vS05/13/101300282. Are you drunk!?``

TextJPN: 「オフタイムに飲んで、何が悪いんですかぁ～！@k@vS05/11/100700244.　あなたは勤務中でも、私はオフ。@k@vS05/11/100700245.おっふっふっふっふ～！」
TextENG: ``What's wrong with drinking when I'm off-duty~!@k@vS05/11/100700244. Even if you're working, I'm not.@k@vS05/11/100700245. Heh heh heh heh heh~!``

TextJPN: …元々、悪ふざけの好きな感じのする大石氏は、すっかり上機嫌で手がつけられない状態だ。
TextENG: Ooishi, who was the sort that'd fool around to begin with, was in such a good mood I couldn't figure out a way to deal with him.

TextJPN: …情報屋からもたらされる貴重な情報を、一言一句聞き逃すまいと緊張状態でやって来た自分とは、あまりに違っていた。
TextENG: ...Completely different than me, who had come worried about getting every bit of information I could.

TextJPN: …大石さん。
TextENG: ...Ooishi-san.

TextJPN: あんた、あれだけの金を鷲掴みで持ってったんだから、それに見合うだけの情報は提供してくれるんだろうなぁ…。
TextENG: After taking so much money, you were supposed to get me information worth at least as much...

TextJPN: と、ここまで思ってから、情報は情報屋がもたらすのだから、仲介人の大石氏はいくら酔っていてもいいことに気付く。
TextENG: I thought this, but then realized that I was getting my information from the informant, so it didn't matter how drunk Ooishi was.

TextJPN: …文句の付け所はないが、何だか微妙にシャクだ。
TextENG: ...It was nothing I could complain about, but I still felt slightly riled up.

TextJPN: 大石氏と情報屋（…どうせ仮名だろうが、彼は佐藤氏と名乗った）に先導され、繁華街の裏道へ、裏道へと進んでいく。
TextENG: Ooishi and the informant (it was no doubt a fake name, but he introduced himself as Sato) led the way deeper and deeper into the back streets of the market district.

TextJPN: あれだけ賑やかな繁華街から、ほんの道を数本違えただけでこれだけ寂しい裏通りになるのだから、夜の街というのはわからない。
TextENG: Even though the market was bustling, a couple of turns off the main street and you were in a desolate alleyway.

TextJPN: 大石氏は、怪しげな小汚いビル脇の階段を上がっていく。
TextENG: Ooishi started climbing a set of stairs on the side of a seedy building.

TextJPN: 看板も何も出ていないし、そもそも店なのか、開店しているのかさえわからない。
TextENG: There wasn't any sort of signage, so I couldn't tell if the place was open, or if it was even a store at all.

TextJPN: 「…安心して下さい。@k@vS05/11/100700247.怪しい店じゃありませんよ。@k@vS05/11/100700248.んっふっふっふ！」
TextENG: ``...Don't worry.@k@vS05/11/100700247. This isn't a dubious place.@k@vS05/11/100700248. Nfu fu fu fu!``

TextJPN: 大石氏の口から出る言葉で、これほど信憑性のないものはないだろう…。
TextENG: Those words, coming from Ooishi's mouth, had absolutely no credibility...

TextJPN: 扉を開くと…、…そこは、幸いにも標準的な雀荘だった。
TextENG: Beyond the door... was thankfully, a typical mahjong parlor.

TextJPN: …警戒していたほどの不審な店ではなく、ほっとする…。
TextENG: I was relieved that it wasn't the sort of suspicious place I had to be on my guard about...

TextJPN: 「ハイいらっしゃい～。@k@vS05/00/tenin00002.あら、大石さんお久しぶりー！@k@vS05/00/tenin00003.　こっち入ります？@k@vS05/00/tenin00004.　すぐ空きますよー」
TextENG: ``Welcome, welcome~.@k@vS05/00/tenin00002. Oh, Ooishi-san, it's been a while!@k@vS05/00/tenin00003. Want to join in?@k@vS05/00/tenin00004. There'll be a free spot soon.``

TextJPN: 「いいえぇ、今日はセットですからいいです。@k@vS05/11/100700250.お、待たせましたねぇ」
TextENG: ``No, no, I'm here with a group today, so it's fine.@k@vS05/11/100700250. Oh, sorry to keep you waiting.``

TextJPN: 麻雀は４人でやるものだ。@k…どうやら、面子のひとりとして先にこの店で待っていたらしい初老の男が腰を上げる。
TextENG: Mahjong is a game played with four people.@k ...It seems that a middle-aged man who was going to be our fourth had already arrived and was waiting for us.

TextJPN: 「遅いぞ蔵人。@k@vS05/00/104800002.俺ぁもぅ帰ろうと思ってたんだからぁ！」
TextENG: ``You're late, Kuraudo.@k@vS05/00/104800002. I was just thinking of going home!``

TextJPN: 大石氏が、人をダシにして遅れた言い訳をしている。
TextENG: Ooishi made an excuse for why we had taken so long.

TextJPN: …やがて、私が新顔だと気付き興味を示した。
TextENG: ...Eventually, realizing that I was a new face, the other man grew interested.

TextJPN: 「彼は赤坂さん。@k@vS05/11/100700252.東京からはるばる出張されてきた、将来有望な新人さんです」
TextENG: ``That's Akasaka-san.@k@vS05/11/100700252. He's a rookie who came all the way from Tokyo on assignment. They have high hopes for him.``
``...Boy.@k@vS05/00/104400006. Can you play mahjong?``

TextJPN: 「ま、…まぁ、…学生時代に、…そこそこに」
TextENG: ``W-Well... I played a bit when I was still a student.``

TextJPN: 佐藤氏と老人は、カッカッカと笑い合う。@k…人をカモにしようという魂胆が見え見えだ…。
TextENG: Sato and the old man cackled in unison.@k ...Their plot to sucker me out of my money was painfully obvious...

TextJPN: 「緊張続きの出張で疲れておいでだろうと思いましてねぇ！@k@vS05/11/100700254.　ひとつ今夜は心の洗濯でもしてさしあげましょうかと思いまして。@k@vS05/11/100700255.むっふっふ！」
TextENG: ``I thought you'd be a bit tired from your assignment leaving you on edge all the time!@k@vS05/11/100700254. So I thought I'd give you a night to cleanse your spirit.@k@vS05/11/100700255. Mfu fu!``

TextJPN: 「……今さら野暮なことを聞きますが、…私たち、警察官ですよね…？」
TextENG: ``...I know asking this now might be stupid... but we're all police, aren't we...?``

TextJPN: 「「がっはっはっはっはっはっは！！」」
TextENG: ``````GA HA HA HA HA HA HA!!``````

TextJPN: 「まぁ～それは言いっこ無しで。@k@vS05/11/100700258.なぁに、実際には賭けるわけじゃありませんよ。@k@vS05/11/100700259.この後い～いお店に遊びに行く時に、誰が全員分を払うのか決めるだけですって～～！@k@vS05/11/100700260.　むっふっふっふっふ～～！！！」
TextENG: ``Well~, let's not talk about that.@k@vS05/11/100700258. Loosen up a bit, we won't actually gamble anything.@k@vS05/11/100700259. We're just deciding whose going to pay for everyone to go play at a very ni~ce place afterward~~!@k@vS05/11/100700260. Mfu fu fu fu fu~~!!!``

TextJPN: 「…遊びに行く？@k@vS05/13/101300286.　どんな店に遊びに行くんですか」
TextENG: ``...Go play?@k@vS05/13/101300286. At what kind of place would you be doing that?``

TextJPN: ３人は口々に『間違えようがないほど』胡散臭い店名を、好き放題に挙げてみせる。
TextENG: Without reservation, the three of them started suggesting places like cabarets, high-class clubs, and even brothels.

TextJPN: ……少なくとも、４人分ともなれば遊びの罰ゲームで済まされる出費ではないだろう。
TextENG: ...At the very least, they were the type of places that you couldn't go to with money that was just 'for funsies.'

TextJPN: 「…私のお金は先日、大石さんに根こそぎ預けて支払いは不可能ですし、…仕事の都合があるので長居はできないのですが…」
TextENG: ``...Ooishi-san took all my money the other day, and I also have work to do, so I can't stay for long...``

TextJPN: 「じゃあ坊主が勝てばいいじゃねぇかよ！@k@vS05/00/104800005.　お前が勝ったらこの雀荘の支払いは無しで、蔵人に仕事の話でも何でもすればいい」
TextENG: ``Then all you have to do is win!@k@vS05/00/104800005. If you win, then you won't have to pay for this table, and you can talk to Kuraudo about work or whatever.``

TextJPN: …どっちに転んでも、彼らはこの雀荘の支払いを自分で持つ気はないみたいだな…。
TextENG: ...No matter what happened, it seemed like they were intent on playing mahjong for free...

TextJPN: ……どうやら、少々覚悟を決めないといけないようだ。
TextENG: ...I would have to fasten my resolve a bit.

TextJPN: このまま舐められ続けても仕事に差し支えるし。
TextENG: If I was going to be underestimated like this forever it was going to get in the way of my work.

TextJPN: 「…わかりました。@k@vS05/13/101300289.では、少しだけお付き合いします。@k@vS05/13/101300290.私が勝ったら、アフターの遊びは一切なしで、すぐに仕事の話に入ってもらいますからね」
TextENG: ``...I understand.@k@vS05/13/101300289. Then, I'll play with you guys for just a bit.@k@vS05/13/101300290. If I win, you guys don't get to go out playing, and we talk about work right away.``

TextJPN: 「「がっはっはっはっはっは！！！」」
TextENG: ``````GA HA HA HA HA HA HA!!``````
``Yeah, yeah!!@k@vS05/11/100700263. Bring it on!@k@vS05/11/100700264. Mfu fu fu!``

TextJPN: 「俺が勝ったら、フラワーのブルー・マーメイドに直行だからなぁ！！」
TextENG: ``If I win, we're headed straight to the Blue Mermaid on Flower Road!!``

TextJPN: 「おやっさんも好きだなぁ～！！@k@vS05/11/100700266.　私はもちろん馴染みの店をハシゴしまくりですよ？@k@vS05/11/100700267.　アケミちゃ～～ん！！！@k@vS05/11/100700268.　むっはっはっはっは！！@k@vS05/11/100700269.　サトさんはどうします？」
TextENG: ``This ol' lech here likes that place too~!!@k@vS05/11/100700266. Of course, we're going to hop between all the favorite places!@k@vS05/11/100700267. Akemi-chaaaan!!!@k@vS05/11/100700268. Mua ha ha ha!!@k@vS05/11/100700269. What about you, Sato-san?``

TextJPN: 「…私は静か～に飲めるお店でいいですよ」
TextENG: ``I'd prefer a place where we can drink 'quietly.'``

TextJPN: 「静かにバニーさんと、でしょー？@k@vS05/11/100700271.　むははははははは！！@k@vS05/11/100700272.　こないだ飲みに行った時、あんたバニーさんのシッポ引っこ抜いちゃったでしょ？@k@vS05/11/100700273.　あれ結局弁償だったの？」
TextENG: ``Like a nice quiet place with a bunny girl?@k@vS05/11/100700271. Muahahahahahaha!!@k@vS05/11/100700272. The last time we went drinking, you pulled the tail right off that bunny girl, didn't you?@k@vS05/11/100700273. Didn't you end up having to pay for that?``

TextJPN: 「マスターに縫製代とか言われて、一本ドンペリ空けられたなぁ」
TextENG: ``The owner started a bottle of Dom Perignon on my tab and called it a 'tailoring fee.'``

TextJPN: 「「わっはっはっはっはっは！！」」
TextENG: ````Wa ha ha ha ha ha!!````

TextJPN: ……なんて賑やかな卓だ。
TextENG: ...What a lively table this was.

TextJPN: …下品な会話の大音量に、他のお客たちから白い目で見られているのがわかる…。
TextENG: ...I could tell the other customers were glaring at us while we loudly continued our crude conversation...

TextJPN: …というか、…自分もその一味だと思われているのが悲しい…。
TextENG: ...Speaking of which, the fact that they assumed I was the same was a bit disheartening...

TextJPN: …予備費は全て大石氏に取られたので、残るお金は全て自費だ。@k…それに、大した金額は入っていない。
TextENG: ...Ooishi had taken all the money I'd brought, so everything I had left was out of my own pocket.@k ...In addition, there wasn't that much left of that, either.

TextJPN: ……このまま彼らに付き合えば、いいように奢らされて、私の財布は夜の街に消える。
TextENG: ...If I kept on hanging around him like this, through his goading, my wallet would disappear into the night.

TextJPN: …何とか彼らに勝たないと、仕事の話に戻れない。
TextENG: ...I had to somehow win and return the conversation to my job.

TextJPN: …この人たち、…どう見ても強そうだしなぁ…。@k…ごめん、…雪絵。
TextENG: ...But these people, no matter how you looked at it, were pretty good...@k ...Sorry, Yukie.

TextJPN: 「なっはっはっは！@k@|@y@vS05/11/100700276.　そんじゃこれで、リーチっと！」
TextENG: ``Na ha ha ha!@k@|@y@vS05/11/100700276. Well then, I'll just call riichi here!``

TextJPN: …まぁ、こんな間抜けなリーチじゃあ、おやっさんもサトさんも引っ掛からないでしょうねぇ。@k赤坂くんあたりからポロッと出てきてくれないですかねぇ、むっふっふ！
TextENG: ...Well, the ol' man and Sato-san probably won't fall for this silly riichi.@k I wonder if Akasaka-kun will spit out what I need, mfu fu fu!

TextJPN: 「蔵人のリーチなんざ、どうせこの辺だろ？@k@vS05/00/104800009.　この辺なら通るだろ」
TextENG: ``At any rate, Kuraudo's hand is probably holding something like that, huh?@k@vS05/00/104800009. In that case, this one oughta' go through.``

TextJPN: 「それ！」
TextENG: ``There!``

TextJPN: おほ！@k　おやっさんもやるじゃないですか。@k私の安全牌でダマ聴、張りましたね？
TextENG: Oh-ho!@k The ol' man's pretty good.@k He's quietly trying to use one of my safe tiles to complete his hand, isn't he?

TextJPN: どうやら赤坂くんも、人のリーチの現物や筋を切るくらいの若葉マーク程度の腕はおありのようですからね。@k…その辺が命取りになるってわけですねぇ！
TextENG: It seems that Akasaka-kun has at least learned the ropes when it comes to guarding against someone's riichi.@k ...But that will be his downfall!

TextJPN: 「…どうした坊主？@k@vS05/00/104800012.　さくっと切らねぇかい。@k@vS05/00/104800013.よくわからなかったら、蔵人と同じモンを切ってりゃ安全だぞ？」
TextENG: ``...What's wrong, boy?@k@vS05/00/104800012. Would you hurry up and discard?@k@vS05/00/104800013. If you're not sure, anything that Kuraudo's already thrown away should be safe, no?``

TextJPN: おぅおぅ、赤坂くんも悩んでますねぇ～！
TextENG: Oooh, Akasaka-kun's really fretting over this one~!

TextJPN: 安全牌はあるけど、切ると@bテンパイ.@<聴牌@>が遠のくから切りたくない、ってのが見え見え。@kう～～ん、初々しい子はいいなぁ☆
TextENG: It was glaringly obvious that he had a safe tile to discard, but he didn't want to throw it away because it would move him farther from completing his hand.@k Mmmm, they're so nice when they're young and innocent☆.

TextJPN: ほぅら、さっさと当たり牌を出しなさい～！
TextENG: Come on, hurry up and throw out the kicker~!

TextJPN: 私に振り込めばムフフではぁはぁなお店！
TextENG: If he gave me the winning tile, we'd be headed to an establishment where I could do with all sorts of licking and sucking!

TextJPN: おやっさんに振り込めばブルマーなメイドさんのお店に直行なんですからねぇ～～！！
TextENG: If he gives the ol' man his winning tile, we'd be headed straight to the place with maids in bloomers~~!!

TextJPN: 「……これは、…通りますか？」
TextENG: ``...This... will go through, right?``

TextJPN: 上目遣いに、恐る恐る出した牌は、@k@|@y…ありゃ、残念。
TextENG: He looked up as he hesitantly threw out a tile that was...@k@|@y ...Oh, too bad.

TextJPN: 「おいおい、危ない牌だぞ？！@k@vS05/00/104800015.　蔵人、通るのかぁ？！」
TextENG: ``Hey now, that's a dangerous tile, you know!@k@vS05/00/104800015. Kuraudo, does that go through!?``

TextJPN: 「えぇえぇ、通りますよ～ぅ！@k@vS05/11/100700278.　むっふっふっふ！」
TextENG: ``Yeah, it will!@k@vS05/11/100700278. Mfu fu fu!``

TextJPN: 今回は運が良かったってことですかねぇ。
TextENG: It seems this time you were lucky.

TextJPN: でも、この局が流れるまでにまだまだツモはあるんですからねぇ！！@k　んっふっふっふ！
TextENG: But as long as the round kept going, I could still win off the draw!!@k Nfu fu fu!

TextJPN: その後も、赤坂くんはのらりくらりとうまく運良くかわし、何とか流局を迎えることができた。
TextENG: But after that, Akasaka-kun managed to luckily avoid throwing any bad tiles, and somehow the round managed to end without anybody completing a hand.

TextJPN: 「@bテンパイ.@<聴牌@>」
TextENG: ``Tenpai.``

TextJPN: 「@bテンパイ.@<聴牌@>」
TextENG: ``Tenpai.``

TextJPN: 「ノー聴」
TextENG: ``Noten.``

TextJPN: サトさんはさすがに２軒リーチが入ってるのを見越してたらしく、ベタ降りで来た様子。
TextENG: Sato-san had keenly anticipated that two players were in riichi and had decided to play it safe.

TextJPN: さすがに渋い打ち方です。
TextENG: What a cool-headed way of playing.

TextJPN: さてさて、赤坂くんのはどんな感じだったんでしょうかねぇ。
TextENG: Now let's see, what kind of hand did Akasaka-kun have?

TextJPN: 麻雀の流局時には、@bテンパイ.@<聴牌@>の人間は手牌を公開しなくてはならない。
TextENG: When the round ends with nobody winning in mahjong, anybody in tenpai has to show their hand.

TextJPN: だが、@bテンパイ.@<聴牌@>に至らない場合は公開の義務がない。
TextENG: But if you're not in tenpai, you have no obligation to reveal it.

TextJPN: …普通の初心者だったら、@bテンパイ.@<聴牌@>してなくても手牌を公開して、ここは良かった悪かった、あとこの牌が来れば@bテンパイ.@<聴牌@>だった…と騒ぐのだが。@k彼はそれをしない。@k…渋い？
TextENG: ...Your average beginner would normally show their hand even if they weren't in tenpai, and start a commotion about how if this tile or that tile came they would be in tenpai.@k But he didn't.@k ...Being stingy?

TextJPN: 「どうだった坊主。@k@vS05/00/104400014.ちょっと見せてみぃ！」
TextENG: ``How'd you do, boy?@k@vS05/00/104400014. C'mon and show me!``

TextJPN: サトさんが、ひっそりと伏せた赤坂くんの手牌を晒そうと手を伸ばす。
TextENG: Sato-san reached over to flip the hand that Akasaka-kun had casually placed face down.
``Hmmm~~...??@k@vS05/00/104400016. What the hell is this...?``

TextJPN: @bテンパイ.@<聴牌@>からは程遠い。@k…やっぱり赤坂くん、全然ダメ？@k　むっふっふっふ…？
TextENG: He was nowhere near tenpai.@k ...Was Akasaka-kun totally bad at this after all?@k Mfu fu fu...?

TextJPN: その時、おやっさんが赤坂くんの河と牌を見比べ始め、怪訝な顔をする。
TextENG: Right then, as the ol' man compared the tiles from Akasaka-kun's hand to the discard pool, a puzzled expression crossed his face.

TextJPN: 「…坊主。@k@vS05/00/104800018.お前、このあたりで張っとるだろ。@k@vS05/00/104800019.どうして切った？」
TextENG: ``...Boy.@k@vS05/00/104800018. You were in tenpai right around here, weren't you?@k@vS05/00/104800019. Why'd you break your hand?``

TextJPN: 「………マンズの高いあたりが急に高騰しましたので抑えました。@k@vS05/13/101300294.大石さんのリーチに対して安全性が高まったのにです。@k@vS05/13/101300295.筋でさばけば無難なのに、わざわざ抑えた方がいる」
TextENG: ``...The higher manzu tiles suddenly got more valuable, so I held them back.@k@vS05/13/101300294. Even though the chance they were safe tiles had increased with respect to Ooishi-san's riichi.@k@vS05/13/101300295. It would have been safer to read the discards, but there was a player who went out of their way to keep the tiles out of play.``

TextJPN: 「……ほぅ。@k@vS05/00/104800021.…蔵人の@bテンパイ.@<聴牌@>など端から論外、というわけか」
TextENG: ``...Oh?@k@vS05/00/104800021. ...So Kuraudo's tenpai was no good from the start, in other words.``

TextJPN: 「…相当高度な引っ掛けでなければ、私の放銃を期待したヌルめの手かと思って。@k@vS05/13/101300297.それよりも、ダマで張ったあなたの方がとりあえずは問題でした」
TextENG: ``...If it wasn't such a high-level trap, I would have thought that you were waiting for me to throw out the winning tile.@k@vS05/13/101300297. But, the more concerning thing is that you were in tenpai and didn't say anything.``

TextJPN: 「いつ、@bテンパイ.@<聴牌@>したのに気付いた？」
TextENG: ``When did you realize I was in tenpai?``

TextJPN: 「……このあたりですか？@k@vS05/13/101300299.　ノンタイムで４連続で切ってますよね。@k@vS05/13/101300300.初めは食い替えかと思いましたが、私をちらちら見ていたので、期待しているんだと気付きました」
TextENG: ``....Around here?@k@vS05/13/101300299. You threw out 4 tiles in a row immediately.@k@vS05/13/101300300. At first I thought you were just discarding redundant tiles, but I noticed you glancing over at me, and realized you were waiting for something.``

TextJPN: …赤坂くん、…あんた…。
TextENG: ...Akasaka-kun... you...

TextJPN: 「赤坂さん、あんた、麻雀始めてどのくらい？」
TextENG: ``Akasaka-san, when did you first start playing mahjong?``

TextJPN: 「高校～大学くらいまでの間しかやっていませんよ。@k@vS05/13/101300302.さ、続けましょう。@k@vS05/13/101300303.サトさんは@bテンパイ.@<聴牌@>しなかったから流れて、次は私ですね？@k@vS05/13/101300304.　…親」
TextENG: ``I never did, except in high school and university.@k@vS05/13/101300302. Now, let's continue.@k@vS05/13/101300303. Since Sato-san wasn't in tenpai and the round ended without a winner, then I'm next, right?@k@vS05/13/101300304. ...The next dealer.``

TextJPN: ………赤坂くんの雰囲気が、…なーんか微妙に変わっているような…。
TextENG: ...It seems like Akasaka-kun is really aware of how the game flows...

TextJPN: 彼をカモろうという和気藹々とした場に、…冷気の混じった緊張感が…。
TextENG: We'd thought we were just going to eat him alive... but it looks like that isn't going to be so easy...

TextJPN: 「…大石さん、ソーズがコスいですね。@k@vS05/13/101300306.回しますか？」
TextENG: ``...Ooishi-san, looks like you're going for the bamboo tiles.@k@vS05/13/101300306. Should I put some in play?``

TextJPN: 「あと３つ、いい牌がくればなぁ…！@k@|@y@vS05/11/100700282.　サトさんはうまく行きそうです？」
TextENG: ``As long as I get 3 more good tiles...!@k@|@y@vS05/11/100700282. Sato-san, think you can do it?``
``Dammit...!@k@vS05/00/104400018. I'll just force you to go for a cheap tanyao!@k@|@y@vS05/00/104400019. Chi!``

TextJPN: 「チーですか？@k@|@y@vS05/13/101300308.　じゃあ、すみません、それポンです」
TextENG: ``A straight?@k@|@y@vS05/13/101300308. Well, sorry, I'm going to pon that tile.``

TextJPN: …おいおい、チーの発声聞いてからポンを決断したよ…！@k　…ってことは…邪魔ポン？！
TextENG: ...Whoa now, going to call three-of-a-kind after he declared a straight?@k ...Trying to override and interfere!?

TextJPN: 「………坊主、お前、場慣れしとるなぁ…！」
TextENG: ``...Boy, you're getting pretty used to this...!``

TextJPN: 「まさか。@k@vS05/13/101300310.…私が生まれる前から打ってるような方々とは比べようもないですよ。@k@vS05/13/101300311.……それです、@|@yロン」
TextENG: ``Oh no.@k@vS05/13/101300310. ...I couldn't even compare to you guys, who have been playing since before I was even born.@k@vS05/13/101300311. ...That's game.@|@y Ron.``

TextJPN: 「トイトイ、赤々、ドラ３」
TextENG: ``Triplets, 2 red dora, and three more dora.``

TextJPN: 「…親ですからね、ちょっぴり高いですよ」
TextENG: ``...I'm the dealer, so this'll cost you quite a bit.``

TextJPN: 「なっはっはっはっはっはっは！！@k@vS05/11/100700284.　赤坂さん、やるなぁ！！@k@vS05/11/100700285.　こりゃあ、我々も本気を出さないと！@k@vS05/11/100700286.　ねぇ？！」
TextENG: ``Na ha ha ha ha ha!!@k@vS05/11/100700284. Akasaka-san, nice job!!@k@vS05/11/100700285. Now we'll have to get serious!@k@vS05/11/100700286. Won't we!?``

TextJPN: 「本気のついでに点棒も出してもらいましょうかね。@k@vS05/13/101300315.…私は眠いんで、手っ取り早く終わらせます」
TextENG: ``Well, can you get serious about handing over your points?@k@vS05/13/101300315. ...I'm tired, so let's end this quickly.``

TextJPN: …赤坂くん？
TextENG: ...Akasaka-kun?

TextJPN: …何だか素敵に凄みが…。@kなはははははは……。
TextENG: ...This is somehow unreal...@k Nahahahaha...

TextJPN: 気付けば、いつの間にか赤坂くんの足元から冷気が噴出しているような錯覚が…。
TextENG: Before I could realize it, there was an ominous cold air emitting from beneath Akasaka-kun's feet.

TextJPN: 「…ヌルいですね。@k@|@y@vS05/13/101300317.マンズの二五八が笑ってませんか？」
TextENG: ``...How blasé.@k@|@y@vS05/13/101300317. The 2, 5, and 8 manzus are laughing at you.``

TextJPN: 「……蔵人、おめぇ差し込め！@k@|@y@vS05/00/104800029.　坊主の親、とっとと降ろすぞ！」
TextENG: ``...Kuraudo, finish it!@k@|@y@vS05/00/104800029. You have to end the boy's turn as dealer!``

TextJPN: 「…悔しいですが、…どうやらそうした方が賢明なようですねぇ…」
TextENG: ``...I hate to admit it, but that seems like the best option...``
``There it is!@k@|@y@vS05/00/104400023. Ron!@k@|@y@vS05/00/104400024. Simple straights, one dora!!``
``...A headbump!?@k@vS05/00/104400026. You damn brat!!``

TextJPN: 「小僧？@k@vS05/13/101300322.　小僧が相手だと馬鹿馬鹿しくて手をゆるむってわけですか。@k@vS05/13/101300323.…じゃああんた、その小僧以下、ってわけですね。@k@vS05/13/101300324.……面白いなぁ。@k@vS05/13/101300325.あんたら連中は決まって、小僧だ坊主だって言うよ。@k@vS05/13/101300326.くっくっく…！」
TextENG: ``Brat?@k@vS05/13/101300322. So you'd play that sloppily against a brat?@k@vS05/13/101300323. ...Guess that means you're worse than a brat yourself.@k@vS05/13/101300324. ...It's so interesting.@k@vS05/13/101300325. The way you guys call people things like 'brat' and 'boy.'@k@vS05/13/101300326. Heh heh heh...!``

TextJPN: 「あ、赤坂くん？@k@vS05/11/100700289.　赤坂くんですよねぇ？@k@vS05/11/100700290.　何だか、ムードが変わりまくりなんですがねぇ…」
TextENG: ``A-Akasaka-kun?@k@vS05/11/100700289. That is you, isn't it?@k@vS05/11/100700290. It feels like you're a totally different person...``

TextJPN: 「………私をカモって今晩はいいお酒を飲むおつもりだったんでしょうが。@k@vS05/13/101300328.どうやら皆さんのアテは外れそうです。@k@|@y@vS05/13/101300329.ロン」
TextENG: ``....You thought that I, being a sucker, would let you drink some good booze tonight.@k@vS05/13/101300328. Seems that you were a little off the mark.@k@|@y@vS05/13/101300329. Ron.``

TextJPN: 「…タンピン三色赤１ドラ１」
TextENG: ``Triple straight, red dora, and another dora.``

TextJPN: 「…うおぉ！！@k@vS05/00/104400028.　張ってやがったかぁあぁああ！！」
TextENG: ``...Whoa!!@k@vS05/00/104400028. He actually did it!!``

TextJPN: 「だからあんた、ヌルいよ。@k@vS05/13/101300332.…いくらダマだからって、こんなにヌルい三面なんだから、読んでくれなくちゃあ」
TextENG: ``That's why I'm saying you guys are slacking.@k@vS05/13/101300332. ...No matter how you look at it, you have to be able to read such an obvious three-way wait.``

TextJPN: 赤坂くんが頬杖を突きながら、くっくっくと笑う。
TextENG: Akasaka-kun chuckled as he rested his chin in his hands.

TextJPN: …そのサマが恐ろしく決まっていて怖い。
TextENG: ...That pose was so fitting it was almost scary.

TextJPN: 「…おい、蔵人！@k@vS05/00/104800031.　話が違うぞ！@k@vS05/00/104800032.　初々しいカモがネギ背負ってきたって言ったのは誰だ！！」
TextENG: ``...Hey, Kuraudo!@k@vS05/00/104800031. This isn't what we discussed!@k@vS05/00/104800032. Who the hell said he was a naive sucker ripe for the picking!?``

TextJPN: 「いや…なっはっはっは…！！@k@vS05/11/100700292.　誰でしょう、ねぇ？」
TextENG: ``Ah... na ha ha ha...!!@k@vS05/11/100700292. Who could it be?``

TextJPN: 「……大石さん、まずいよ。@k@vS05/00/104400030.このままじゃ負けるよマジで！」
TextENG: ``...Ooishi-san, this is bad.@k@vS05/00/104400030. If he keeps going like this, we're seriously going to lose!``

TextJPN: …赤坂くん。@k…私を本気にさせるとは。
TextENG: ...Akasaka-kun.@k ...For you to make me get serious.

TextJPN: …どうやら本気で完膚なきまでに叩きのめしてもらいたいようですねぇ…。
TextENG: ...Looks like you really want to be milked dry...
``Pon.@k@vS05/13/101300334. ...Pon.@k@vS05/13/101300335. ...That sounds nice, one more time! Pon.``

TextJPN: 赤坂くんが軽快に鳴きまくる。
TextENG: Akasaka-kun was almost singing at this point.

TextJPN: …晒した牌はいずれもピンズ。
TextENG: ...The tiles he had open were all pin tiles.

TextJPN: …おいおいマジかよ、そんな大味なことで清イツなんてやる気かよッ？！
TextENG: ...You can't be serious... are you really going for the flush!?

TextJPN: 「…ポン」
「…坊主、……正気か…？@k@vS05/00/104400032.　４つも晒したら…おめぇ、牌が１つだけじゃねぇかよ」
TextENG: ``...Boy... are you right in the head...?@k@vS05/00/104400032. You've opened four sets.... you only have one tile left, you know.``

TextJPN: 「そうですね。@k@vS05/13/101300338.…知ってます？@k@vS05/13/101300339.　単騎待ちって、一番読まれにくいらしいですよ」
TextENG: ``That's right.@k@vS05/13/101300338. ...Did you know?@k@vS05/13/101300339. Waiting on a single tile is the hardest thing to read.``

TextJPN: 「バ、バカかてめぇ！！@k@|@y@vS05/00/104400034.　そこまで染め手晒しといて、今さら出ると思うんじゃねぇ！！」
TextENG: ``A-are you an idiot!?@k@|@y@vS05/00/104400034. With that much of your hand revealed, you don't think we'd give you a tile you need, do you!?``

TextJPN: 「……んっふっふっふ！@k@vS05/11/100700294.　…読めてますよ赤坂さん」
TextENG: ``....Nfu fu fu!@k@vS05/11/100700294. ...I know what you're doing, Akasaka-san.``

TextJPN: 「…それ、清イツでもホンイツでもないんでしょ？」
TextENG: ``...That's not a flush or a half-flush, is it?``

TextJPN: 「４つポンした時点でトイトイは成立してますからね。@k@vS05/11/100700297.…あんたは今、絶好の単独トップ。@k@vS05/11/100700298.…こいつは、…清イツと見せかけてトイトイで食おうという、挑発手でしょ？」
TextENG: ``The fact that you called Pon four times means you're already in position for an all-triplet hand.@k@vS05/11/100700297. ...Right now, you're far and away in the lead.@k@vS05/11/100700298. ...You're trying to show a flush and goad us into giving you triplets, aren't you?``

TextJPN: 「…そう思うなら、ピンズ、切ってみます？」
TextENG: ``...If that's what you think, want to try throwing out some pins?``

TextJPN: 「大石さんの牌の左５つ。@k@vS05/13/101300343.さっきから切り損ねてるピンズですよね。@k@vS05/13/101300344.それを端から順に切ってみたらいいんじゃないですか？」
TextENG: ``The left five tiles in your hand, Ooishi-san.@k@vS05/13/101300343. They're pin tiles you're reluctant to throw away, aren't they?@k@vS05/13/101300344. Why don't you try discarding them in order from the left?``

TextJPN: …マジかよおい…。
TextENG: ...You must be joking...

TextJPN: こいつ麻雀の神さまかよ…。@kさもなきゃ、普段は劇画の中の主人公に違いない！！
TextENG: Is he a mahjong god...?@k If not, he had to be the main character of a manga or something!!

TextJPN: その時、おやっさんが卓の下からサインを送ってきた。@kサインは明朗にして単純。
TextENG: At that moment, the ol' man sent me a sign under the table.@k The message was simple and clear.

TextJPN: （…蔵人。…やれ。叩き潰せ）
TextENG: (...Kuraudo. ...Do it. Crush him.)

TextJPN: （……こんな若い子に、サマは好きじゃないんですがねぇ）
TextENG: (...I don't like to cheat against kids like this.)

TextJPN: （あほぅ！　ここまで舐められて今さら引けるか！）
TextENG: (Idiot! After being disrespected like this we can't pull back now!)

TextJPN: （…もー知りませんよ？　ではどうぞ）
TextENG: (...Well, I'm not responsible for what happens, you know? Go ahead.)
``Here we go, boy!@k@|@y@vS05/00/104800036. Riichi!!@k@vS05/00/104800037. We'll go open!@k@vS05/00/104800038. I'm waiting for a 1, 4, or 7 of pins!``

TextJPN: 恐らく、この中に赤坂くんの待ちも含まれている。
TextENG: Most likely, the tile that Akasaka-kun was waiting for was one of those tiles.

TextJPN: …これで赤坂くんは出アガリはなくなったってわけだ。
TextENG: ...With this, Akasaka-kun was no longer capable of winning the hand.

TextJPN: …ツモる時に、…次に赤坂くんがツモる上ヤマをすりかえる。
TextENG: ...When I drew from the wall... I switched out the tile that Akasaka-kun would draw.

TextJPN: …掴ませる牌は、一ピン。
TextENG: ...The tile that I put in was the 1 pin.

TextJPN: おやっさんの当たり牌だ。
TextENG: One of the tiles that the ol' man was waiting on.

TextJPN: 赤坂くんは少し前に落としてるから当たる心配はない…。
TextENG: Akasaka-kun discarded it a little while ago, so there was no threat of it being the one he needed...

TextJPN: 「…ほれ、坊主の番だぜ」
TextENG: ``...Come on, it's your turn, boy.``

TextJPN: ツモが一ピンであることに、少々の動揺をしたのがわかる。@k…当然、切れない。
TextENG: I knew he was troubled that the tile he drew was the 1 pin.@k ...Of course, he couldn't discard it.

TextJPN: 「坊主。@k@vS05/00/104800040.わかってると思うが、…オープンリーチに振り込んだら役満払いだぜ？」
TextENG: ``Boy.@k@vS05/00/104800040. You must be aware, but... if you discard into an open riichi, it's worth the limit, you know?``

TextJPN: 「言われるまでもありませんよ」
TextENG: ``You don't have to tell me that.``

TextJPN: 赤坂くんの手から出たのは、@k@|@y…字牌！
TextENG: The tile that came from Akasaka-kun's hand was,@k@|@y ...an honor tile!

TextJPN: か～～～！！　渋いですねぇ！
TextENG: Whew!! Ain't that something!

TextJPN: その北、あと一枚しか残ってないヤツじゃないですか！@k　あんた、なんてぇ渋いので単騎待ちしてたんですかぁ！！
TextENG: There's only one North wind tile left, isn't there?@k You were counting on a really rough wait, weren't you!!

TextJPN: しかし、…これで赤坂くんの命運は確定する。
TextENG: But... with this, Akasaka-kun's fate was decided.

TextJPN: 「…ふふん、小僧」
TextENG: ``....Heh heh, brat.``

TextJPN: 「…命拾いしたな。@k@vS05/00/104800043.…だが手牌は一枚だ。@k@vS05/00/104800044.逃げ切れなくなることもあるんじゃねぇのか…？@k@vS05/00/104800045.　ふふん…」
TextENG: ``...You're lucky you're safe.@k@vS05/00/104800043. ...But your hand only has a single tile.@k@vS05/00/104800044. You think you'll be able to run away the rest of this round...?@k@vS05/00/104800045. Heh heh...``

TextJPN: 「……やっぱりそういうことか」
TextENG: ``...So, it's going to be like that.``

TextJPN: 赤坂くんが眼光鋭くおやっさんを睨みつける。
TextENG: Akasaka-kun glared at the ol' man with a discerning eye.

TextJPN: …こいつ、勘も鋭いよ。@kサマで握らされたこと、看破した？！
TextENG: ...This guy had pretty good instincts.@k Did he figure out we were cheating!?

TextJPN: （…やめましょうよおやっさん、赤坂くんの方が二、三枚は上手です）
TextENG: (...Let's stop this. Akasaka-kun is a step or two ahead of us.)

TextJPN: （ばーろい！！　ここまで来てやめられるかよ！　次行け！　掴ませちまえ！！）
TextENG: (Fool! You think we can stop after we've come this far? Next! Make him draw it!!)

TextJPN: ……次に赤坂くんに、七ピンを握らせる。
TextENG: ...The next tile Akasaka-kun would draw was the seven pin.

TextJPN: …それで、決まりだ。@k赤坂くんはどっちを切ってもおやっさんに振り込む。
TextENG: ...With that, it would be settled.@k No matter which one he discarded, he'd play right into the ol' man's hand.

TextJPN: …絶対確定の…役満払い！！
TextENG: ...An unavoidable full payout!!

TextJPN: 自分のツモの時に…こっそりと赤坂さんの次のツモ牌を…。
TextENG: When I drew my tile... I sneakily swapped Akasaka-san's---

TextJPN: 「へっくしッ！！！」
TextENG: ``Achoo!!!``

TextJPN: がっしゃ！
TextENG: *Crash*

TextJPN: …なんだなんだ？！
TextENG: ...What!?

TextJPN: …赤坂くんは突然くしゃみをして、…自分の上ヤマを崩してしまった？！
TextENG: ...Akasaka-kun suddenly sneezed, collapsing the wall of tiles in front of him!!

TextJPN: 「お、…おいおい、何やってんだよ…」
TextENG: ``H-....Hey, what are you doing...``

TextJPN: 「すみません、ついくしゃみをした拍子にヤマを崩しちゃって。@k@vS05/13/101300351.…罰符払いですね。@k@vS05/13/101300352.親だから、４０００オールですか？@k@vS05/13/101300353.　それとも罰符は積み棒に？」
TextENG: ``Sorry, I accidentally knocked over the wall when I sneezed.@k@vS05/13/101300351. ...There's a penalty for that, right?@k@vS05/13/101300352. I'm the dealer, so four thousand to everybody?@k@vS05/13/101300353. Or should I pay a deposit?``

TextJPN: 「……………わっはっはっはっはっはっはっはッ！！！」
TextENG: ``...Wa ha ha ha ha ha!!!``

TextJPN: もう、堪えきれなくて大笑いしてしまった。
TextENG: Unable to hold back, I guffawed.

TextJPN: 赤坂くんは二回、積み込まれて、逃げられない牌を積み込まれることを知って、@k…自分でヤマを崩して逃げるという荒技を披露した…というわけだ！
TextENG: Akasaka-kun, knowing he was going to be cornered a second time and unable to escape...@k He took the drastic measure of knocking over his own wall!

TextJPN: 「…やるな坊主…！！@k@vS05/00/104800048.　役満払いをそういう手で防ぐとはな！！@k@vS05/00/104800049.　がっはっはっはっはっはっは！！！」
TextENG: ``...You're good, boy...!!@k@vS05/00/104800048. To get away from a full payout like that!!@k@vS05/00/104800049. Ga ha ha ha ha ha!!!``

TextJPN: 「…大石さんもそんな見え見えのツミ込みは勘弁して下さい。@k@vS05/13/101300355.…これが馬場なら、今ので卓をひっくり返してたところですよ…」
TextENG: ``...Ooishi-san, could you not bother putting me in such an obvious trap?@k@vS05/13/101300355. ...If we were at Baba, this would have been the point where I flipped the table...``

TextJPN: 「いえいえいえいえいえ、すみませんすみません！@k@vS05/11/100700303.　あなたを侮っていましたよ！@k@vS05/11/100700304.　あなたどうしてどうして、お強いじゃあないですか！」
TextENG: ``Oh no no no no, sorry, sorry!@k@vS05/11/100700303. I underestimated you!@k@vS05/11/100700304. For some reason, you're really good, aren't you!``

TextJPN: 「正直に話さんかい。@k@vS05/00/104800051.若い頃はだいぶ馴らしたんだろ？」
TextENG: ``Answer me honestly.@k@vS05/00/104800051. You got a lot of experience when you were younger, didn't you?``

TextJPN: 「…早稲田、高田馬場辺りでだいぶ遊ばせてもらいました。@k@vS05/13/101300357.ちょっと勝ちまくりすぎて、馴染みの店に出禁を食らいまして。@k@vS05/13/101300358.…今の家内にだいぶ怒られて、足を洗ったんです」
TextENG: ``I played quite a bit around Waseda and Takadanobaba.@k@vS05/13/101300357. The place I frequented banned me for winning too much.@k@vS05/13/101300358. ...I made the woman who would become my wife pretty angry, so I washed my hands of it all.``

TextJPN: 「勝ちまくりすぎて？@k@vS05/00/104400037.　あんた、当時はどのくらいの勝率でやってたの？」
TextENG: ``Raised the stakes too high?@k@vS05/00/104400037. How much were you playing for at the time?``

TextJPN: 「面子にもよりましたが、歌舞伎町辺りで打つときはほぼ負けなしでした。@k@vS05/13/101300360.特に、相手が『アレ』系の人のときは命かかってましたからね」
TextENG: ``It depends on who I was playing with, but I had an almost perfect record playing in Kabukicho.@k@vS05/13/101300360. Especially since when I played against a certain crowd, my life was on the line.``

TextJPN: い、命ってっっ？！？！
TextENG: 20 times!?!?

TextJPN: 何なんだよその勝負！@k　あんたのメンツはヤクザ？@k　それとも外国マフィア？！
TextENG: What kind of stakes were those?@k Did you have yakuza at your table?@k Or pro baseball players!?

``...What's this!?@k@vS05/00/104800053. Kuraudo!!@k@vS05/00/104800054. You buffoon!!@k@vS05/00/104800055. Where did you pull this guy from? He's practically a professional!!@k@vS05/00/104800056. I give up!!@k@vS05/00/104800057. Geez!!@k@vS05/00/104800058. Boy, it's your win!@k@vS05/00/104800059. I surrender!!``

TextJPN: 「ありがとうございます、光栄です」
TextENG: ``Thank you very much, it was an honor.``

TextJPN: 「…なっはっはっは…。@k@vS05/11/100700306.いやいや。@k@vS05/11/100700307.…しかし赤坂さん、あんた、打つと性格変わるねぇ～！@k@vS05/11/100700308.　何で就職なんかしたの！@k@vS05/11/100700309.　あんたならフリーで充分にメシ食っていけるじゃない！」
TextENG: ``...Na ha ha ha...@k@vS05/11/100700306. Oh my.@k@vS05/11/100700307. ...Akasaka-san, your personality really changes when you play~!@k@vS05/11/100700308. Why do you even have a day job!@k@vS05/11/100700309. You'd have no problem living as a freelancer!``

TextJPN: 「プロ雀士には腕とツキの両方が必要なんですよ。@k@vS05/13/101300363.私には後者がありませんでしたから」
TextENG: ``To be a pro mahjong player, you need both talent and luck.@k@vS05/13/101300363. I didn't have anything like that supporting me.``

TextJPN: 「…ツキなんて、その時の運不運だろ。@k@vS05/00/104400039.あんたほどの腕があれば充分にいけると思うがなぁ」
TextENG: ``...Luck is luck.@k@vS05/00/104400039. With somebody of your skill, I'd think you'd be able to make it pretty far.``

TextJPN: 「並みのツキじゃダメなんですよ。@k@vS05/13/101300365.カンしたら３回に１回くらいはそのままカンドラが４つ乗って、ここぞという時に狙ってリンシャンが引ける。@k@vS05/13/101300366.そのくらいじゃないと」
TextENG: ``Normal luck doesn't cut it.@k@vS05/13/101300365. Calling a Kan and one time out of three, you can aim to win on the extra draw with four dora.@k@vS05/13/101300366. That kind of luck.``

TextJPN: 「……赤坂くん、そんなのが頻繁に出来たら、そりゃもう超能力者ですよ…」
TextENG: ``....Akasaka-kun, if you can judge something like that, you're already bordering on the supernatural...``

TextJPN: 「いえ、イカサマでも超能力でもなく、そのくらいの打ち手は結構いるんですよ」
TextENG: ``No, there's plenty of people who can do that without cheating or superpowers.``

TextJPN: 「新宿で知り合った、鳴く度にドラが乗りまくる雀士なんか鬼のように強かったですし、@k@vS05/13/101300369.横浜で打ったプロなんかは、当り前のように一発で引き当ててましたからね。@k@vS05/13/101300370.私にはあぁいうツキがないんです」
TextENG: ``There was a person I met in Shinjuku who would get doras every time you blinked... he was as strong as a demon.@k@vS05/13/101300369. There was a pro I played with in Yokohama, who would draw the tile he needed immediately after calling Riichi like it was an everyday thing.@k@vS05/13/101300370. I don't have that kind of luck.``

TextJPN: …何だよその連中…。悪魔に魂売ってるんじゃないの…。
TextENG: ...What type of folks were those... They weren't named Ryuu or Satoshi by any chance...?

TextJPN: 「と言うわけで、総合トップは私で、よろしいですね？」
TextENG: ``Well then, is it alright if I'm declared the overall winner, then?``
``Yeah yeah~!@k@vS05/11/100700312. We totally lost!@k@vS05/11/100700313. Mfu fu fu~!``

TextJPN: 「負けた負けた！@k@vS05/00/104800061.　久しぶりに大負けだ～～！！」
TextENG: ``I lost, I lost!@k@vS05/00/104800061. It's been a while since I lost this big!!``

TextJPN: 「しっかし…打ってる時の坊主、気合入ってたなぁ。@k@vS05/00/104400041.結構怖かったぜ…」
TextENG: ``Still, when you were playing, boy, you were pretty into it.@k@vS05/00/104400041. It was kind of scary...``

TextJPN: 「よく言われます。@k@vS05/13/101300373.…自分ではそんなに目つき変えてるつもりはないんですがね。@k@vS05/13/101300374.…そんなに怖い目になってましたか…？」
TextENG: ``I hear that a lot.@k@vS05/13/101300373. ...I don't mean to change gears like that, though.@k@vS05/13/101300374. Did I really look that scary...?``

TextJPN: 「「うんうん」」
３人で大きく頷きあう。
TextENG: The three of us nodded emphatically in agreement.

TextJPN: ……天才雀士、赤坂くんかぁ。
TextENG: ...So that was Akasaka-kun, the mahjong prodigy.

TextJPN: …彼が出張から帰る前に、何かの大きな勝負の卓に代打ちで出てくれないかなぁ！
TextENG: ...Before he goes home from his assignment, maybe I could have him go play at a high-stakes table in my place!

TextJPN: …なーんて、欲を掻いちゃいけませんね。@kんっふっふ！
TextENG: ...But it's not good to get greedy.@k Nfu fu!

TextJPN: 「…じゃー仕方ないや。@k@vS05/11/100700316.約束です。@k@vS05/11/100700317.夜の学習会はこれでお開きにしましょう。@k@vS05/11/100700318.申し訳ありませんね、おやっさん。@k@vS05/11/100700319.今夜はこれでお開きです」
TextENG: ``...Well then, nothing for it.@k@vS05/11/100700316. It was a promise.@k@vS05/11/100700317. We'll break up our little late-night study group right now.@k@vS05/11/100700318. Sorry about this, ol' man.@k@vS05/11/100700319. That's it for tonight.``

TextJPN: 「しゃーねぇな。@k@vS05/00/104800064.帰って寝るわ！@k@vS05/00/104800065.　体力付けんと体がもたん！」
TextENG: ``Nothing you could do.@k@vS05/00/104800064. I'm going home to sleep!@k@vS05/00/104800065. My body won't last like this!``

TextJPN: 「お仕事が大変なんですか？」
TextENG: ``Problems at work?``

TextJPN: 「あぁ、おやっさんは雛見沢ダムの第１工区の監督さんなんです。@k@vS05/11/100700321.住民とは連日、小競り合いをしてますからね。@k@vS05/11/100700322.しんどい商売ですよ」
TextENG: ``Oh, he's the foreman of the primary construction site at the Hinamizawa Dam.@k@vS05/11/100700321. He's butting heads with the residents every day.@k@vS05/11/100700322. It's a rough business.``

TextJPN: 「…来年あたり、第２工区も任されちまうかもしれねぇなぁ。@k@vS05/00/104800067.黒田さん、血圧上がりまくりって聞いたしよ。@k@vS05/00/104800068.身がもたねぇよ」
TextENG: ``...Around next year, I might be in charge of the second site as well.@k@vS05/00/104800067. I heard that Kuroda-san was pissing blood.@k@vS05/00/104800068. He won't hold out much longer.``

TextJPN: 「おやっさんなら大丈夫でしょ。@k@vS05/11/100700324.あなた、見た目よりもツラの皮、厚めですしね。@k@vS05/11/100700325.んっふっふっふ！」
TextENG: ``You'll be alright, ol' man.@k@vS05/11/100700324. Your skull is thicker than it looks.@k@vS05/11/100700325. Nfu fu fu!``

TextJPN: 「俺だって仏じゃねぇからなあ！@k@vS05/00/104800070.　ハラワタ煮えくり返る時はあるぞー？@k@vS05/00/104800071.　特に、園崎のあの小娘は我慢がならん！@k@vS05/00/104800072.　あいつの顔面、いつか簡単にゃ治らんくらいに歪ませたろって思ってる」
TextENG: ``I'm not exactly a saint, you know!@k@vS05/00/104800070. There's times that just make my blood boil.@k@vS05/00/104800071. I especially can't stand dealing with that bratty daughter of Sonozaki's!@k@vS05/00/104800072. I think one of these days I'm going to rearrange her face.``

TextJPN: 「まぁまぁまぁ！@k@vS05/11/100700327.　でも給料はいいんでしょ？@k@vS05/11/100700328.　かなり破格の給金だって聞きましたよ」
TextENG: ``Now now now!@k@vS05/11/100700327. At least the pay is good, right?@k@vS05/11/100700328. I heard the wages were pretty exorbitant.``

TextJPN: 「当り前だ！@k@vS05/00/104800074.　あんなに世知辛い職場で給料が安かったら誰も残らんよ！@k@vS05/00/104800075.　おい蔵人、警察はいつになったら村の人間、全部追っ払ってくれるんだ。@k@vS05/00/104800076.国から立ち退き命令とか出てるんだろ？！」
TextENG: ``Of course they are!@k@vS05/00/104800074. If the pay was cheap, nobody would hang around that god-awful job!@k@vS05/00/104800075. Hey Kuraudo, exactly when are the police going to tell all the villagers to shove off?@k@vS05/00/104800076. There'll be a notice of eviction from the government, right!?``

TextJPN: 「…ん～～～…。ねぇ？　どうなってるんでしょうねぇ？」
TextENG: ``...Hmmm... Maybe? I wonder what will happen.``

TextJPN: 雛見沢ダムの現場監督だと名乗った、おやっさんは、その後もしばらくグチっていたが、ひとしきり吐き出すとすっきりしたようで、大人しく立ち去っていった。
TextENG: The old man, who identified himself as the foreman of the Hinamizawa Dam, spewed a few complaints until he felt better about it, then left quietly.

TextJPN: 「じゃ、行きましょう。@k@vS05/11/100700331.…後はサトさんに任せますかね」
TextENG: ``Well then, let's go.@k@vS05/11/100700331. ...I'll leave the rest to Sato-san.``

TextJPN: 「…大石さんは帰られるんですか？」
TextENG: ``...Ooishi-san, are you going home?``

TextJPN: 「私が一緒でも、お邪魔しちゃうだけでしょ。@k@vS05/11/100700333.それに、サトさんの仕事を買ったのはあなたです。@k@vS05/11/100700334.私は対価を払ってませんからね」
TextENG: ``If I'm here, I'll just be in the way, won't I?@k@vS05/11/100700333. Besides, the one who bought Sato-san's services was you.@k@vS05/11/100700334. I didn't pay for my share.``

TextJPN: 大雑把かと思えば、妙なところで律儀。
TextENG: Ooishi-san was kind of sketchy, but he was strangely conscientious about some things.

TextJPN: …その辺の不可解に若干、大石氏と自分の世代差を感じなくもない。
TextENG: ...I felt quite a bit of a gap between myself and Ooishi's generation from that part of him I didn't comprehend.

TextJPN: 「じゃあ、坊主。@k@vS05/00/104400044.…いやぁ、雀士さまにもう坊主なんて言えねぇな。@k@vS05/00/104400045.赤坂くんでよかったっけ？」
TextENG: ``Then, boy.@k@vS05/00/104400044. ...No, I can't call Mr. Mahjong here 'boy' no more.@k@vS05/00/104400045. Is 'Akasaka-kun' all right with you?``

TextJPN: 「はい」

TextENG: ``Then, Akasaka-kun.@k@vS05/00/104400047. Shall we go?``

TextJPN: 「では赤坂さん。@k@vS05/11/100700336.また。@k@vS05/11/100700337.…何か困ったことがあったらいつでも頼りに来て下さいね」
TextENG: ``Well then, Akasaka-san.@k@vS05/11/100700336. Later.@k@vS05/11/100700337. ...If you're having any trouble, you can count on me any time.``

TextJPN: 「大石さんにお支払いできるような対価は、もう持ってませんよ？」
TextENG: ``I don't have any more money to pay you, you know that?``

TextJPN: 「んじゃ、今度の勝負で少し手加減してもらえたらチャラにしますよ。@k@vS05/11/100700009.なっはっはっは！」
TextENG: ``'kay. If you go easy on me the next time, we'll be even.@k@vS05/11/100700009. Na ha ha ha!``

TextJPN: 大石氏は、まだまだ遊び足りなさそうだったが、それ以上はしつこくせず、夜の町並みに消えて行った…。
TextENG: Ooishi, seemingly still not having had his fill of playing around, but without overstaying his welcome, disappeared into the night.
